title: ML: Logistic Regression Decision
story: Logistic regression predicts class 1 if probability > 0.5, which happens when z > 0 (before sigmoid).
instructions: Predict class. Given coef=[1, -2], intercept=3, input=[5, 1]. Calculate z=coef·x+intercept. Print 1 if z>0 else 0.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

coef = np.array([1, -2])
intercept = 3
x = np.array([5, 1])

# Calculate linear combination
z = np.dot(coef, x) + intercept

# Decision: z > 0 means probability > 0.5, predict class 1
if z > 0:
    print(1)
else:
    print(0)
